intro: Allosorus aquilinus, commonly known as the mountain alpine bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are usually erect and branching. Allosorus aquilinus is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in alpine gardens.
